result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D. OTT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Heroin, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 01-28-16 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy D. OTT
Current: 421 N. 5th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2015)
Prior: 1931 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-14-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $750.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.   Bail furnished.
